meanings.definition: The quality or state of being repressive.
meanings.sent1: The repressiveness of the government's rules stifled creativity in the community.
meanings.sent2: The repressiveness of the atmosphere made it difficult for people to express themselves freely.
meanings.sent3: The repressiveness of the strict dress code led to some hilarious fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: The repressiveness of the silence in the library was like a heavy weight on everyone's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The repressiveness of the dark clouds overhead foretold an impending storm.

meanings.definition: The act of repressing or suppressing something.
meanings.sent1: Her repressiveness of emotions caused her to keep everything bottled up inside.
meanings.sent2: The repressiveness of the information was necessary to maintain confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The repressiveness of the secret recipe made everyone curious about its ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The repressiveness of the dam holding back the water was crucial for flood control.
meanings.sent5: The repressiveness of the security measures prevented any unauthorized access to the building.
